snippet: The attorney general has opted to try to stem the nation’s infamous violence by crushing the gangs.
abstract: El Salvadoran Atty Gen Douglas Melendez begins arresting law enforcement officials who facilitated truce between government and country's gangs that won international support and has significantly reduced street violence; Pres Salvador Sanchez Ceren rejected truce when he assumed office in 2014 and has taken hard-line stance against gangs, rejecting negotiations and initiating no-holds-barred crackdown instead.

byline.contributor: Elisabeth Malkin and Azam Ahmed contributed reporting from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: The attorney general has opted to try to stem the nation’s infamous violence by crushing the gangs.

headline.main: El Salvador Throws Out Gang Truce and Officials Who Put It in Place
headline.print_headline: El Salvador Throws Out Gang Truce and Officials Who Put It in Place
